column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : Yeah , well our biggest strength was our defence , so if we can play the defence , we can .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) The defence was where you won those games .
#Text=You blocked them off .
#Text=Particularly Mexico , they could n't ... Canada was even better .
#Text=You kept on forcing turnovers , forcing timeouts .
#Text=That was the defensive game , was the way you won it .
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : Absolutely .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) But Germany had a good defensive game as well .
#Text=It must have been good , playing on your birthday .
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : It was really cool .
#Text=The whole team , the whole Australian Paralympic team wished me happy birthday , the whole crowd sang me happy birthday and this sort of stuff .
#Text=It was pretty special , but once you get into it , it 's just another game .
#Text=I know all the people were talking about the fact that it was my birthday , but it did n't [ get to me ] .
#Text=It was fun .
#Text=It was fun .
#Text=Not a bad place to have your birthday .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) So how do you compare London with Beijing and Athens ?
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : Well , I think every games gets a little bit better anyway .
#Text=Like , Beijing was better than Athens and I think London was a lot better than Beijing again .
#Text=But I think the special thing about London is that it was British , and so they obviously support Australians , but we were just athletes to them , I think .
#Text=Whereas in Beijing we were still disabled athletes .
#Text=But in London we were just athletes and they loved our sport and they understood our sport , which was really cool .
#Text=The crowds ... it was amazing .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) We have a lot of statistics on the response to it .
#Text=Unfortunately , being in London I could n't see the TV coverage .
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : Back here the ABC did a fantastic job with us .
#Text=Everybody knows about the Paralympics .
#Text=Everybody saw something .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Apparently there was extra requests for the Gliders .
#Text=So more people wanted to see you .
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : People like basketball .
#Text=Basketball is very easy to relate to .
#Text=Team sports are good to watch .
#Text=But I think , like I was saying earlier , if you take away the wheelchair , there 's nothing to do with disabilities .
#Text=If an able bodied jumped into a wheelchair , it 's exactly the same as us .
#Text=Whereas an able bodied ca n't run against someone with blades .
#Text=You know ?
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Yes .
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : So I think that 's why ; it 's very relatable , and obviously it 's fun to watch .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) It seems be be getting bigger with each set of games .
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : Definitely .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) I 've got figures from Google .
#Text=London is twice as big .
#Text=Shelley Chaplin : Yep .
#Text=Absolutely .
#Text=The Paralympic movement is exciting because we 're all amateur athletes , and we 're all doing it because we love the sport .

#Text=I think , during Beijing , I know in the Australian media they tried to get everyone to look away from our disabilities and look at us just as athletes , but I think in London they were like , here 's their disabilities , here 's what they are doing athletically , and combining the two , which made for amazing coverage , right ? Cause everyone understood our disabilities but our sport as well .
